title: CNN captures moment secret police find and arrest suspected spy
description: CNN's Sam Kiley follows Ukraine's secret police as they apprehend a suspected spy who allegedly provided Russian forces details about the Ukrainian military.

title: Boeing needs to get its 's*** together,' Ryanair CEO says
description: The CEO of Ryanair let loose a scathing, obscenity-laden attack on Boeing management Monday, saying company executives need either an immediate "reboot, or a boot up the a**."

title: The death of the McDonald's peace theory
description: It's the definitive end of two distinct eras:

title: The 'new face' of the anti-abortion movement
description: Following the leak of the SCOTUS draft opinion that would overturn Roe v. Wade, CNN's Elle Reeves talks to anti-abortion activists in Missouri who are working to limit abortions in the state.

title: How China's workers are faring during a tumultuous supply chain crisis
description: China's supply chain crisis and its global impact is leaving companies with increasing costs and consumers with indefinite waiting times to receive goods. CNN's Selina Wang offers an inside look at the country's lockdowns, a strain on shipments and how China's factory workers are reacting to the shifting landscape.

title: Ukraine hunts spies selling information to Russia
description: On a dusty street in the eastern Ukrainian town of Sloviansk, a man in a long-sleeved black shirt and cargo pants smokes a cigarette. He's being watched.

title: Heard says role in 'Aquaman 2' was reduced after Depp's attorney called her abuse claims a 'hoax'
description: Amber Heard finished testifying on direct examination in the $50 million defamation case with ex-husband Johnny Depp on Monday, following a week-long break in proceedings.

title: Orange County shooting suspect was upset over China-Taiwan tensions, investigators say
description: A suspect in a deadly shooting at a church in Laguna Woods, California, has been identified, authorities said.

title: Baby formula manufacturer Abbott reaches deal with FDA, could restart plant within 2 weeks
description: The baby formula manufacturer at the heart of a nationwide formula recall said Monday that it has reached an agreement with the US Food and Drug Administration to enter into a consent decree, a legally binding agreement that would require the company to take certain steps in response to violations found at its Sturgis, Michigan, facility.

title: Thousands of Britain's fish and chip shops could close within a year. Here's why
description: The future of the United Kingdom's fish-and-chip shops are under severe strain as the prices of key ingredients — including cod and cooking oil — soar as a result of the Russian assault on Ukraine.

title: Exclusive: Amanpour speaks with Taliban deputy leader
description: In his first on-camera interview showing his face, Afghan Interior Minister and one of the FBI's Most Wanted Sirujaddin Haqqani speaks with Christiane Amanpour in Kabul, discussing women's rights, security threats, and the US bounty on him.

title: Snapchat CEO surprises college graduates by paying off their student loans
description: Snapchat CEO and co-founder Evan Spiegel and his wife Miranda Kerr made donations to repay student loans for the newest graduates of Otis College of Art and Design. The couple were invited as keynote speakers and awarded with honorary degrees from the school.

title: CNN anchor has emotional reaction to covering mass shootings
description: CNN's Victor Blackwell gets emotional talking about covering another mass shooting in the US following the deaths of 10 people in a massacre at a supermarket in Buffalo, New York.

title: Al Jazeera journalist Shireen Abu Akleh's brother slams violent actions of Israeli police at her funeral
DeSantis eyes state takeover of Disney's special district
description: After stripping Disney of its special governing powers last month, Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis now says that he wants the state to take over the government body that has overseen the entertainment company's Orlando-area theme parks for half a century.

title: What a royal funeral in the UAE says about the nation's future
description: In a smooth transition of power over the weekend, the United Arab Emirates' Supreme Council of rulers selected the nation's third president.

title: Biden approves plan to redeploy US troops to Somalia
description: President Joe Biden has approved a request by the Pentagon to redeploy US troops to Somalia in an effort to counter the terrorist group al-Shabaab, a senior administration official said on Monday.

title: F1's jewelry ban is for right reasons, says GPDA's Wurz
description: Formula One is right to ban jewelry from the cockpit but the governing FIA could have enforced the rule in a less confrontational way, according to Grand Prix Drivers' Association (GPDA) chairman Alex Wurz.

title: 'When is it going to be enough?': SE Cupp to right-wing media
description: CNN political commentator SE Cupp weighs in on the parallels of the fatal shooting in Buffalo and other mass shootings and how some elected officials have helped fuel the rise of extremism.

title: How early traumas can affect your relationship with money
description: Divorce. Job loss. Business failure. Eviction. Bankruptcy. Poverty.

title: Watch 18-year-old sit in for Pearl Jam drummer
description: 18-year-old Kai Neukermans performed on drums with Pearl Jam after the band's drummer Matt Cameron tested positive for Covid-19.

title: Kids can show anxiety symptoms early on. Here's how to spot them
description: Your child doesn't want to go to the playground to play with other kids. Or she doesn't want to attend a friend's birthday party or the class pool party.

title: The one thing that terrifies White nationalists is what makes America great
description: The horrific attack in Buffalo this weekend by an 18-year-old White gunman that left 10 people dead was, per the local sheriff, a "straight up racially motivated hate crime."  The US Department of Justice backed up that view. They said they're investigating the mass shooting at a grocery store frequented mostly by Black customers "as a hate crime and an act of racially-motivated violent extremism."

title: Total lunar eclipse creates dazzling 'blood moon'
description: The moon glowed red on Sunday night and the early hours of Monday, after a total lunar eclipse that saw the sun, Earth and moon form a straight line in the night sky.

title: 'We are the last generation': China's harsh lockdowns could exacerbate population crisis
Top dealmaker says Chinese markets are 'close to the bottom'
description: One of China's top investment bankers says the country's stock markets appear to be nearing "the bottom."

title: Daniil Medvedev still hopeful of playing in Wimbledon
description: World No. 2 Daniil Medvedev has not given up hope of competing at Wimbledon next month even though tournament organizers have banned Russians and Belarusians from playing at the grass court grand slam due to Moscow's invasion of Ukraine.

title: Kim Jong Un mobilizes military after criticizing his cabinet over Covid outbreak
description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un has mobilized the military to respond to the country's first officially acknowledged outbreak of Covid-19, as the impoverished nation scrambles to address what state media has described as a "major national emergency."

title: 'We are the last generation': China's lockdowns could exacerbate population crisis
Russian forces are ransacking Ukrainian teachers' homes in search of textbooks
description: When masked Russian soldiers ransacked Nina's home in northeastern Ukraine at 6 a.m. one day in late April, they were not searching for weapons. Instead, they were looking for her Ukrainian textbooks.

title: This decadent dish showcases the famous black truffle
description: In the Umbria region of Italy, most people enjoy their meats. Pork and wild boar are key -- and sometimes the only -- dishes on a hearty Umbrian menu. But pork is not the only specialty in the region.

title: Man Ray's 'Le Violon d'Ingres' photograph sells for record $12.4 million
description: Man Ray's famed "Le Violon d'Ingres" made history Saturday when it became the most expensive photograph ever to sell at auction.

title: Pennsylvania Senate candidate Fetterman suffers stroke but says he's 'well on my way to a full recovery'
description:
• How the Pennsylvania GOP primaries are playing out in right-wing media
• Oz fights off McCormick's millions and Barnette's surge in final days of Pennsylvania Senate primary

title: Suspect in deadly California church shooting was detained and hog-tied by churchgoers, official says
description: At least one person is dead and four are critically injured after a shooting Sunday at a church in Laguna Woods, California, according to the sheriff's department.

title: The latest on the Russian invasion of Ukraine
Buffalo shooting suspect made disturbing statements after his arrest
description:
• What we know about Buffalo supermarket shooting suspect Payton Gendron 
• Twitch says livestream of Buffalo mass shooting was removed in less than 2 minutes

title: How revenge travel became a trend
description: As more and more countries reopen their borders to eager tourists, a trendy new phrase has emerged on social media: revenge travel.

title: Xi looms large over Australia's election
A 'hero' security guard, a former fire official's mother and a teacher were among the 10 people killed at a Buffalo grocery store
description: Thirteen people were shot -- 10 fatally --  at a Buffalo, New York, supermarket Saturday in a massacre authorities believe was racially motivated.

title: Billboard Music Awards 2022: Here are the winners
description: The winners of the Billboard Music Awards are being revealed Sunday.

title: Naomi Judd remembered in song and tears at public memorial
description: Remarks and music with lyrics about love, loss and heaven were a common thread throughout the public memorial held for Naomi Judd Sunday at Ryman Auditorium in Nashville, Tennessee.

title: Jason Momoa apologizes after taking photos in the Sistine Chapel
description: "Aquaman" star Jason Momoa took to Instagram to apologize for taking photos in the Sistine Chapel -- by posting a sweaty, shirtless workout video.
